TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MessagePart extends System.Web.Services.Description.NamedItem

Docs.summary: Represents the messages to be broken up into their logical units with specific abstract information for each part. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The MessagePart class corresponds to a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) `part` element enclosed by the `message` element, which is in turn enclosed by the `definitions` root element. For more information about WSDL, see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
## Examples The following example demonstrates a typical use of the MessagePart class. The `element` and `targetNamespace` parameters are user-defined strings passed into this method call.
[!code-cs[DescriptionNamespaceSample1#10](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.services.de_52_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[DescriptionNamespaceSample1#10](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.web.services.de_52_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[DescriptionNamespaceSample1#10](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.services.de_52_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the XML data type of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property corresponds to the `type` attribute of the `part` element for which the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.MessagePart> class serves as a wrapper. In general, it refers to a data type defined in the XSD schema, but it can also be extended, as long as the XML namespace used is different from that of Web Services Description Language (WSDL).
## Examples The following example demonstrates a use of the Type property.
MessagePart_Type#1
